data.title: Resident Services Offices
data.text:
If you accept a longer waiting time in our Resident Services Offices you can pick-up your requested identification documents without an appointment.

There are several time slots where you can pick-up your documents. At the Resident Services Offices Otto-Schill-Straße, Wiedebach-Passage and Paunsdorf-Center these are the following:

Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and Friday: from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m.

Thursday: from 1 p.m. to 7 p.m.

Saturday: from 8 a.m. to 1 p.m.

At the other Resident Services Offices are other time slots available:

Monday: from 9 a.m. to 12 a.m. and from 1 p.m. to 4 p.m.

Tuesday: from 9 a.m. to 12 a.m. and from 1 p.m. to 6 p.m.

Wednesday: from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m.

Thursday: from 9 a.m. to 12 a.m. and from 1 p.m. to 6 p.m.

Friday: from 9 a.m. to 12.30 p.m.

It can happen that some Resident Services Offices will close for a short time due to trainings or other reasons so there is no possibility to pick-up your documents without an appointment. We will publish all information about short-term closures on our website www.leipzig.de/buergeramt.

Of Course, you can make an appointment for the pick-up of identification documents as well. Please use www.termin.leipzig.de for this.

Application for certificates of conduct (Führungszeugnis)

Certificates of conduct can be applied online at https://www.fuehrungszeugnis.bund.de.

Registration certificates and tax-ID number

Registration certificates and tax-ID numbers should be requested by e-mail to melde-pass@leipzig.de or by post to the Identification Card, Passport and Registration Authorities. You can find more information about the procedure and payment here.

If it is not possible to apply by e-mail or post, we ask you to only book an appointment if the registration certificate must be presented within the next week.

Since October 1, 2020, an extended registration certificate is no longer required to register a wedding at the Leipzig Civil Registry Office if you have your sole or main residence in Leipzig.

Residential parking permit (Anwohnerparkgenehmigung)

It is currently also possible to apply for residential parking permits by e-mail to genehmigung@leipzig.de.

For a personal visit, make an appointment with the public order office, subject area permits.

Cleaning tokens (Stadtreinigung)

Tokens can be purchased at various gas stations. You can find an overview at www.stadtreinigung-leipzig.de.

Submit an application form within a stipulated period.

The timely submission of application forms can be submitted to the City of Leipzig's deadline mailbox at the New Town Hall.

Leipzig-Passport (Leipzig-Pass)

Leipzig-Passports that expire between July 1, 2020 and June 30, 2021 are automatically valid for one more year. In this case, an application is not required.

During this time, they entitle you to use the Leipzig-Pass-Mobilcard and serve as proof of entitlement to a discount in the sales outlets or during ticket control. The Leipziger Verkehrsbetriebe GmbH (LVB) have been informed accordingly.

The above-mentioned Leipzig-Passports also entitle you to use cultural and sporting activities as well as educational offers without an additional note.

The Council made this decision at its meeting on November 12, 2020.

If you cannot keep an appointment that has already been booked, we ask you to change or cancel the appointment with the help of the change-PIN and your appointment number.

The cancelation or change can also be made at www.termin.leipzig.de in the lower area under "arrange appointment with". If it is not possible to change your appointment, we ask you to cancel and re-book an alternative appointment yourself.

If you do not have your PIN or appointment number at hand, send us an email at buergeramt@leipzig.de with the appointment information and office location to be canceled and then book a new appointment.

The Federal Ministry of the Interior, Building and Community has published the following information: If your identification card and/or passport has recently expired or will expire soon and you no longer have valid identification (identification card or passport), the Identification Card, Passport and Registration Authorities, during the pandemic, will generally not initiate any fine proceedings against violations of the identification requirement. Prerequisite: The ID document expired on March 1, 2020 or afterwards. This applies until regular service operations take place again.

If your ID document expired before March 1, 2020 and you were not in possession of another valid ID document (for example a passport), the initiation of a fine proceedings will be examined in individual cases. You can explain any circumstances to be taken into account that led to a delayed application when you reapply for your ID document.

Leipzig-Passports that expire between July 1, 2020 and December 31, 2020 are automatically valid for two more years. Leipzig-Passports that expire between January 1, 2021 and December 31, 2021 are automatically valid for one more year. In this case, an application is not required.

During this time, they entitle you to use the Leipzig-Pass-Mobilcard and serve as proof of entitlement to a discount in the sales outlets or during ticket control. The Leipziger Verkehrsbetriebe GmbH (LVB) have been informed accordingly.

The above-mentioned Leipzig-Passports also entitle you to use cultural and sporting activities as well as educational offers without an additional note.

The Council made this decision at its meeting on June 23, 2021.

A certified copy is only carried out in cases in which the original was issued by an authority or the certified copy is to be presented to an authority.

We ask you to book an appointment only if the certified copy must be presented within the next four weeks.

The number of certified copies is currently limited to a maximum of five per appointment. Please understand that it is not possible to issue further copies during your appointment in order to reduce contact times.

Please bring the original documents and the copies to be certified yourself. A coin-operated copier is available to you in most of the Resident Services Offices.
